title: feat: Generated JS migrations in modern ESM format
body:
### Issue description

Generated JS migrations in modern ESM format
See also: https://nodejs.org/api/esm.html

> ECMAScript modules are [the official standard format](https://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-modules) to package JavaScript code for reuse. Modules are defined using a variety of [import](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/import) and [export](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/export) statements.

### Expected Behavior

Generate ESM JS migrations, with import/export
So the migration works in a ESM codebase.

### Actual Behavior

Generate CommonJS JS migrations
So migrations dont work now in a ESM codebase.

### Steps to reproduce

Add `"type": "module",` to your package.json
Generate migrations with cli with the -o
